"What are the ways you're organizing to fight back as oppression is mounting?" https://t.co/4fyomsL4SO

We have resistance in New York but much less repression so I applaud you https://t.co/XexZlvogmy
"We've worked hard to educate people the importance of not selling their land. If nobody sells that is key to blocking companies."
"A person may have legal title to their land but the government owns the subsoil." https://t.co/HG3OyXSIEu
"The companies always come in with lies and trickery when they want to buy land in a community" https://t.co/2I3BwqYoY2
"How is it companies can just come in and take land? Whose is it?" @NISGUA_Guate @JusticiaYaNYC https://t.co/06XB5lWhIW
There's a long history of resistance to mining operations. https://t.co/0nevABytBV
"The peace treaty was signed in 1996 but the war practices go on" @JusticiaYaNYC https://t.co/mkhxN4kVlz
"We hope that the companies know that there's no where on earth they can go to violate the human rights of people." - Llan Carlos Dávila
"As people opposed to extractive industries we believe in peaceful resistance." - Llan Carlos Dávila @NISGUA_Guate https://t.co/nqJ46LRmny
"Armed groups are something we left in the passed. We're aware of this tragic history in which many innocent died. It's not the solution"
"What is the status of armed resistance in Guatemala today?" https://t.co/r9hl3rhp9a
"Similar to #guatemala, in the Philippines there has been a long history of oppression and resistance." https://t.co/Dm8h5WX71H

"I was journalist in the movement." https://t.co/MWHsnvEtiQ
